intro: Commelina frutescens, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, blue-violet flowers. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Commelina frutescens is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in wet areas.
